result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Lee Crone

defendant.name: Crone, Victor Lee
defendant.address: c/o Linda Quaderer 9588N Zhaanwanong Street, Hayward, WI 54843

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Notice of Hearing - Mailed to:  9588N Zhaanwanong Street c/o Linda Quaderer
No Mail Receptacle

1:27 PM Defendant Victor Lee Crone in court.  Attorney William Lund Norine in court for Victor Lee Crone.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Norine acknowledges information, waives reading. Atty Norine enters Not Guilty Plea on the behalf of the DEF. Court enters NG Plea to all counts. Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. State does not object to setting a status conference. All parties agree, Court schedules.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:49 AM Defendant Victor Lee Crone in court.  Attorney William Lund Norine in court for Victor Lee Crone.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty  Norine indicates DEF  to waive preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. 
Court addresses the violation report.  Attny Norine makes statement and indicates Justice Point will be rectified today.  State makes statement and requests no action to be taken.   Court addresses DEF regarding bond conditions, DEF responds.   Discussion follows.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 8:55 AM Defendant Victor Lee Crone in court.  Attorney William Lund Norine in court for Victor Lee Crone.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court makes statement.  Attny Norine makes statement, and indicates DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  DEF agrees.  State no objection.   Bond continues.    Attny Norine to set preliminary hearing with JA.

11:06 AM Defendant Victor Lee Crone in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  DEF indicates Attny Mike Kelsey will be representing.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 2 and 3.   Court sets preliminary hearing.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.  DEF signed bond in court.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
CASH BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

11:45 am  DEF Victor Lee Crone in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.   CBS $5000 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.    Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for July 1, 2022 at 11:00 AM.
